Award.AwardTitle: Statistical Inference of Models with Time-Varying Parameters
Award.AbstractNarration:
The investigator studies estimation, testing and construction of simultaneous confidence regions for time-varying parameters in models with non-stationary and dependent errors. The simultaneous confidence regions can be used to test patterns of associations between covariates and responses. The investigator also develops new tools for asymptotic analysis of non-stationary time series.

During the last decade, models with time-varying data generating mechanisms have gained substantial attention in various fields including economics, finance, engineering, sociology, medical science, environmental science among others. Results from the proposal are useful for understanding the dynamic association between explanatory variables and responses for temporally observed data in which the underlying physical mechanism change with respect to time.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Project Outcomes Report for the General Public

The PI performs statistical inference for models with parameters that can change over time. The traditional assumption that the values of parameters do not vary can be violated for models that involve a reasonably long period of time. Such models have gained substantial attention in various fields including economics, finance, engineering, sociology, medical science, environmental science among others. By allowing parameters to be non-constant and time-varying, we are able to explore the dynamic association between covariates and responses. The PI develops parameter estimation, hypothesis testing and construction of simultaneous confidence regions for time-varying parameter functions in such models with non-stationary and dependent errors, thus effectively characterizing the time-varying associations. As a primary tool, the PI develops the very deep Gaussian approximation or strong embedding result in probability theory, and novel asymptotic results for non-stationary time series.

The project leads to publications in leading statistics and probability journals; education of future statisticians on the theory and practice of non-stationary time series analysis and models with time-varying parameters, and dissemination of the research results through teaching, invited seminars and conferences, and collaborations with researchers from other disciplines in other regions and countries on similar research topics.
